item.title: 5 Sinag Maynila Filmmakers that inspire us
item.description:
5 Sinag Maynila Filmmakers that inspire us

,

A very 'Brillante' year

CHALLENGES were aplenty during the shoot of the five entries in this year's Sinag Maynila film festival. Joselito "Jay" Altarejos recalled that his film, "TPO," underwent several "script and treatment changes" during filming. The gritty adult drama, which tackles domestic violence, inevitably became a litmus test for Altarejos. "So many things happened.

item.title: Berlin film festival: director defends eight-hour movie that features hour-long lunch break
item.description:
Berlin film festival: director defends eight-hour movie that features hour-long lunch break

Filipino director Lav Diaz says movies should not be judged by their length, so he gave the Berlin film festival a historical drama about the Philippines that runs more than eight hours.

item.title: How 3 Women Made Estonia's 'Fargo' in 6 Weeks
item.description:
How 3 Women Made Estonia's 'Fargo' in 6 Weeks

Meet Fargo's European counterpart: Mother, a new crime thriller from Estonia. Directed by Kadri Kousaar , Mother exposes the vermin beneath the quaint veneer of life in a small town. It's a quietly thrilling whodunit that demonstrates mastery of nuanced character humor. Like Fargo, it deals in absurdity and lurches toward a grim twist.

,

How 3 Women Made Estonia's 'Fargo' in 6 Weeks

item.title: 8 Somewhat Unusual Excuses I Give for Not Working on My Screenplay
item.description:
8 Somewhat Unusual Excuses I Give for Not Working on My Screenplay

,

8 Somewhat Unusual Excuses I Give for Not Working on My Screenplay

For every word I've ever written on a screenplay, there was an equal number of excuses in my head not to write them. Screenwriters, you know. You might be using one right now to not work on your screenplay.

item.title: 2016 Cannes Film Festival Unveils Directors' Fortnight Picks, Including New Films From Paul Schrader and Laura Poitras
item.description:
2016 Cannes Film Festival Announces Directors' Fortnight | Indiewire

,

2016 Cannes Film Festival Unveils Directors' Fortnight Picks, Including New Films From Paul Schrader and Laura Poitras

The 48th annual edition of the Cannes Film Festival's lauded Directors' Fortnight section announced its picks this morning and, as ever, it includes a hefty number of new works from rising stars, festival favorites already garnering serious acclaim and some of the most buzzed-about international offerings on the circuit.

item.title: An Oscar That's Worth the Oscars?
item.description:
An Oscar That's Worth the Oscars?

A look into the surging career of up and coming actor, Oscar Isaac, and his rapid rise to fame, bringing forth the possibility for a future Academy Award triumph.
